name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"f16a0eab-f423-4ead-a1ec-ad2bdf3c0e13","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"85e45474-9149-4d16-9e9c-7b5474bb4b25","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is a specialized data structure used to capture the state of a variable or definition at a specific coordinate in the source code. In static analysis, the "points-to" set of a variable can change from line to line. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" records exactly what a variable could represent at a specific ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (line number), allowing the system to build a chronological history of data flow.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5daae2de-8ba8-46f6-aecc-f21b2b51d629","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"d3fd99cb-1bce-4b74-ae4c-c3532a6d3002","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5bc9b33d-6d0c-4174-af55-970ef6336f46","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"points_to","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The collection of namespaces, identifiers, or definitions that the item points to. This represents the potential "values" at this specific point in time.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c30a2687-dd48-4d66-b714-c1316bdb0fe3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"int","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The line number in the source code where this state was recorded.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"082af027-1689-429f-932a-e8a39de9d3b0","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f41bc8c0-c7c4-4640-946f-29659b0b7aea","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b06730f8-9220-4a6f-aa34-be9b638616de","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__(row, values=set())
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the item while ensuring type consistency for the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"points_to","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" attribute.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"b3392f69-172c-44a3-89b1-2debb110b6a2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The source code line number.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"869cc0be-103a-4434-ad0c-85f39fa90bc5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"values","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The initial points-to data. It automatically normalizes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"list","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inputs into a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ensure uniqueness and set-based logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"124738a5-6780-433e-9271-1f6528c32e6a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__lt__(other)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Implementation of the "less than" operator. This allows ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects to be sorted automatically by their line number.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"a8ed9620-7542-468f-8773-6147e28f0dd6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is critical for reconstructive analysis, where the system must process flow points in the order they appear in the file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"32c86052-5eff-4bb0-8b37-0bf4b9865403","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"8ca12273-b284-4bd9-9fb2-4cf5465a747a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4639939a-c3a9-458e-8da4-29e0c73f1110","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is typically used to create a timeline of how a variable's possible values evolve.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6de1af54-f5cf-4a9c-937a-0961b4c6161b","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from points import PointItem

# 1. Create points for different lines of code
# Line 10: x points to "Admin"
point1 = PointItem(row=10, values="Admin")

# Line 25: x could now point to "User" or "Guest"
point2 = PointItem(row=25, values=["User", "Guest"])

# 2. Sorting items
points_list = [point2, point1]
points_list.sort() # Uses __lt__ to sort by row

for pt in points_list:
    print(f"Line {pt.row}: points to {pt.points_to}")

# Output:
# Line 10: points to {'Admin'}
# Line 25: points to {'Guest', 'User'}","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"54513542-6f15-4d32-a946-5c7330aac444","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f015b700-c569-4ba9-bdc5-ad25876c94b8","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Temporal Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By associating sets with line numbers, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PointItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows Jarvis to answer questions like: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""At line 15, did this variable point to a sensitive source?"","styles":{"italic":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"518a708b-5a5b-41f0-85fb-b62f9e92bfa2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Automatic Normalization","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The constructor's ability to convert strings and lists into sets simplifies the logic in the main analyzer, allowing it to pass data in various formats without manual conversion.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a24797a9-cb8a-4dd5-8a69-2d7c19bab0eb","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Ordered Analysis","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Because it supports comparison (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__lt__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), the analysis engine can easily aggregate points from different parts of a file and re-order them to simulate the sequential execution of the program.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fe1db22e-6866-4a4d-a498-77f4a05c0c27","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
